structured.title: Rachel Shares Rick and Morty Voice Rituals
structured.overview: Rachel discusses her voice acting process and warm-up rituals for performing Rick in Rick and Morty. She explains the specific lines she repeatedly uses to get into character, such as the more conversational "Caribbean Queen, written by Hugh Jackman, age 16" and the heightened, angry launch line "Touch my shit and die. That's not a threat from me. That's how advanced my shit is." She demonstrates how these lines help her shift between tones and then transitions into delivering in-character dialogue as Rick and Morty. Rachel also summarizes recent news about co-creator Dan Harmon addressing his strained relationship with Justin Roiland, noting that they have not spoken since 2019, tensions around writers brought in from Community, and Justin‚Äôs unhappiness during production. The clip blends behind-the-scenes acting insight with commentary on the show‚Äôs creators and short in-character sketches.

apps_results.content:
## Voice acting warm-up rituals  
- Rachel uses specific lines to get into character  
- Repeats ‚ÄúCaribbean Queen, written by Hugh Jackman, age 16‚Äù  
- For anger scenes, yells ‚ÄúTouch my shit and die‚Äù  

## Purpose of signature lines  
- ‚ÄúCaribbean Queen‚Äù used for conversational Rick tone  
- ‚ÄúTouch my shit and die‚Äù used for heightened, yelling energy  
- She cycles these lines before and during sessions  

## Dan Harmon and Justin Roiland fallout  
- Dan and Justin haven‚Äôt spoken since 2019  
- Last text conversation made Dan Harmon cry  
- Justin said he was unhappy; talk became confrontational  

## Creative tensions on Rick and Morty  
- Justin reportedly stopped coming to the office after season 3  
- He disliked Dan bringing in Community writers  
- Dan said he wanted both to be ‚Äúincreasingly lazy‚Äù  

## Show updates and character snippets  
- New Rick and Morty season drops October 15  
- New season features two new voices for leads  
- Brief Rick and Morty dialogue snippets referenced  

## Next steps  
- Expect new season release on October 15  
- Watch for reception to new voice actors
